column1: The '''Field of Cormallen''' was a tree-lined field in [[North Ithilien]]
column2: on the banks of the [[Anduin]] near [[Cair Andros]] and [[Henneth Annûn]].<ref name=RKCorm/>

column1: It is told that the tree ''[[culumalda]]''
column3: was especially abundant in Cormallen<ref name=RC/>

column1: After returning from the [[Battle of the Morannon]]
column2: [[Aragorn]] set up his camp on the Fields of Cormallen in {{TA|3019}}. There
column3: he received [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]] and [[Samwise Gamgee|Sam]] after their rescue from the wreckage of [[Mount Doom]]. They were greeted by many friends
column4: and were praised in the celebration of the victory in the [[War of the Ring]].<ref name=RKCorm>{{RK|Cormallen}}</ref><ref name=RC/>

column1: The name ''Cormallen'' is [[Sindarin]] and means "golden circle" (from ''[[cor]]''
column2: "ring" and ''[[mallen]]'' "gold"). Apparently the name derived from the tree ''[[culumalda]]''.<ref name=RC>{{HM|RC}}

column1: The [[Gondorians]] likely used the name ''Cormalthen'' as in [[Gondor Sindarin]] compounds retained the [[wikipedia:Fricative consonant|spirant]]. The spelling ''Cormallen'' follows the "proper" Elvish Sindarin
column3: however in Gondor this remained ''malthen''.<ref name="VT4227">{{VT|42}}
